overview_of_class: The goal of this course is to present statistical methods for describing and analyzing multivariate data.  Topics covered will include principal component analysis, factor analysis, multidimensional scaling, canonical correlation, and clustering.  Although the statistical theory behind the methods will be discussed, the course will emphasize the statistical and geometric motivation for the method, the practical application of the methods, and the interpretation of the results.
name: Applied Multivariate Analysis
subject: STAT
